subject: AI
title: EU AI Act
description: Understanding the world's first comprehensive AI regulation.

hook.text: The EU AI Act is law. If your AI product serves EU users and you're not compliant, fines can reach â‚¬35 million or 7% of global revenue.

buildup.text: The Act classifies AI systems by risk: unacceptable (banned), high-risk (heavy regulation), limited risk (transparency requirements), and minimal risk (no requirements).

discovery.text: High-risk categories include: AI in hiring, credit scoring, education, healthcare, and law enforcement. These require risk assessments, documentation, human oversight, and accuracy monitoring.

twist.text: Even 'low-risk' AI chatbots must disclose they're AI. If users can't tell they're talking to a machine, you're in violation. Transparency requirements apply broadly.

climax.text: Start compliance now: classify your AI systems by risk level, document your data practices, implement human oversight for high-risk systems, and add AI disclosure to user-facing interfaces.

punchline.text: AI regulation isn't coming. It's here. Comply proactively or pay reactively.

quiz.question: What does the EU AI Act require for all AI chatbots?
options: Transparency disclosure that users are interacting with AI
